http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#Catalog.label: Catalog
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#Catalog.definition: A curated collection of metadata about resources (e.g., datasets and data services in the context of a data catalog).

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#Dataset.label: Dataset
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#Dataset.definition: A collection of data, published or curated by a single source, and available for access or download in one or more represenations.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#CatalogRecord.label: Catalog Record
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#CatalogRecord.definition: A record in a data catalog, describing the registration of a single dataset or data service.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#Distribution.label: Distribution
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#Distribution.definition: A specific representation of a dataset. A dataset might be available in multiple serializations that may differ in various ways, including natural language, media-type or format, schematic organization, temporal and spatial resolution, level of detail or profiles (which might specify any or all of the above).

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#accessURL.label: access address
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#accessURL.definition: A URL of a resource that gives access to a distribution of the dataset. E.g. landing page, feed, SPARQL endpoint. Use for all cases except a simple download link, in which case downloadURL is preferred.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#bbox.label: bounding box
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#bbox.definition: The geographic bounding box of a resource.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#byteSize.label: byte size
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#byteSize.definition: The size of a distribution in bytes.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#centroid.label: centroid
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#centroid.definition: The geographic center (centroid) of a resource.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#compressFormat.label: compression format
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#compressFormat.definition: The compression format of the distribution in which the data is contained in a compressed form, e.g. to reduce the size of the downloadable file.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#contactPoint.label: contact point
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#contactPoint.definition: Relevant contact information for the catalogued resource. Use of vCard is recommended.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#dataset.label: dataset
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#dataset.definition: A collection of data that is listed in the catalog.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#distribution.label: distribution
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#distribution.definition: An available distribution of the dataset.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#downloadURL.label: download URL
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#downloadURL.definition: The URL of the downloadable file in a given format. E.g. CSV file or RDF file. The format is indicated by the distribution's dct:format and/or dcat:mediaType.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#keyword.label: keyword
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#keyword.definition: A keyword or tag describing a resource.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#landingPage.label: landing page
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#landingPage.definition: A Web page that can be navigated to in a Web browser to gain access to the catalog, a dataset, its distributions and/or additional information.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#mediaType.label: media type
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#mediaType.definition: The media type of the distribution as defined by IANA.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#packageFormat.label: packaging format
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#packageFormat.definition: The package format of the distribution in which one or more data files are grouped together, e.g. to enable a set of related files to be downloaded together.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#record.label: record
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#record.definition: A record describing the registration of a single dataset or data service that is part of the catalog.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#theme.label: theme
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#theme.definition: A main category of the resource. A resource can have multiple themes.

http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#themeTaxonomy.label: theme taxonomy
http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#themeTaxonomy.definition: The knowledge organization system (KOS) used to classify catalog's datasets.
